title: Connect East Asian Entrepreneurs
description: There are no initiatives to attract and engage East Asian entrepreneurs where they are, in their local language.

f6_assessments.q0: Tapping into regions to create awareness, especially in east Asia is a strategic white spot for Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: Plan, team with relevant experience and engagement is promising great success. part of the team is highly engaged already and has a track record of success within the Catalyst community.
f6_assessments.q2: Clear measures are given, scope is well defined.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very well written and provides a deep insight on how it will help outreach new proposers to boost up and scale up the cardano project catalyst. The target area (east asia) provided by the proposal here is a gold mine when it comes to ideas and Entrepreneurs. People in general have lot of ideas, skill set and focus but not necessarily enough financial opprtunities. Traditional VC funding is really tough to get because of high competition and various other factors. This proposal, if fulfills its goal, then will help onboarding many more cool ideas to project catalyst, triggering a wave of awesome real life problem solving projects/ideas. Cardano will be pushed closer to its goal of  becoming world financial operating system if this proposal fulfills its goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is well diverse and their skill set is well outlined in the proposal. Additionally, the phases of proposal are well outlined, making it clear for the community how and when certain milestone will be reached.

Therefore, I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2:
The information given in this proposal is very well written, beginning from kick off phase to following months, giving the details what the proposer wants to achieve in each of these individual months. 

This proposal is very well written and give a high confidence to community on funding it, because if funded, the community can easily map the progress from the outlined milestones and key performance indicators here. Ofcourse there might be some unknown things that may affect the velocity of the proposal, but overall i am pretty confident that this proposal can be audited for its progress and success with great accuracy.

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
The problem has been identified as no initiatives to attract East Asian entrepreneurs in local languages.


Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
Yes as it will attract E Asian entrepreneurs

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes  
 

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
Yes key metrics and goals are stated clearly



Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes 

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
Yes team members names and handles are provided. Linkedin or FB profiles, websites of work done, experience obtained etc would be necessary which I have not seen.
 
Are these links sufficient?
The links given are the names and handles of the team members.
 
Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
There are several links with names of organizations that take me to their website. By going to their website it does not become clear on what basis the proposers are partnering with them. It would be better to highlight the nature of the partnership and what they bring to the proposal because otherwise there is no way to know what the partnership is or what it would do to make the proposal successful.


Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
No. They seem competent but there is no confirmed way to assess it. 

Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
Yes the team members are listed.  

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
He has laid out his structure rationally 



Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
 Yes

IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
 Yes

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
A contingency fund has been allocated of 5% 

Have you verified this plan?
 The plan seems sound but I would give it a 75% success rate.


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
Yes very well


Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
Yes its well laid out


Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Yes very well.
 


Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
Yes 

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
Challenges and risks have not been mentioned
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
Yes the roadmap and milestones are clearly laid out

 

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
Yes

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes
 

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes

 

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
They dont appear to have been identified but two contingency funds have been set aside. one for 1680 USD and one for 1000 USD

 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
Not indicated.



 

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
not indicated.

f6_assessments.q0: The goal and metrics of this proposal align well with the challenge being set. It clearly articulates the problem and the proposed solution goes together with it well. The team has made sure that they have explained their proposal in detail.
f6_assessments.q1: This team is very capable of completing their proposal because they not only have the skillset but also understand how the Cardano ecosystem operates in detail. That makes this team a great first point of contact for East Asian Entrepeneurs.
f6_assessments.q2: They have provided sufficient information and plenty of detail as to why their proposal is needed, their KPI, budget, and all other needed information. There is nothing that I see in this proposal that makes it seem like auditing the progress of it will be complicated.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal will, if successfully executed, reach out to a lot of proposers in a so far relatively lowly represented area. Great idea.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is very big, diverse, to some part representative of eastern asia and consists partially of some trusted members of the Catalyst circle. The plan is very detailed and comprehensive, the budget has a good rationale. I really believe this project will succeed if funded.
f6_assessments.q2: With the detailed and comprehensible plan and milestones it should be very easy to track the progress and success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: Possibly the best proposal I have seen written so far! Definitely meets the challenge and seems scalable. The impact is more localised in the first instance (in terms of target audience) but with increased engagement by entrepreneurs (in any region) the impact will hopefully be more global as time goes on. Any voter should have no issues understanding the purpose of this project and it appears to be a good use of funds.
f6_assessments.q1: As far as project plans go, again, this is one of the best I have seen so far. The budget appears to be reasonable and the team is well-rounded. I would feel confident that they have the ability to run such an event/programme.  As someone with 10+ years in running online events/training sessions, I'm pleased to see that the team don't appear to be overloading participants or expecting too much of them in a short space of time. The course appears balanced and reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: There are quite a few raw numbers listed which make it easier to audit and evaluate the success of this project. And by and large, they seems reasonable. My only feedback would be the cost of the marketing. With 100 participants (not output) and a 10k increase in social media following, I wonder if either the targets are too low or the budget is too high. The effective "cost of acquisition" is enormous if we assume just these numbers. If you expect to get more for this marketing budget, it would be good to be explicit about this in amongst the numbers

solution: Use the Eastern Town Hall & targeted virtual events to establish and support a network of East Asian entrepreneurs.
experience: Co-Founders of Catalyst Swarm, Eastern Townhall, Catalyst School. IT & Software Engineering. educators and accountant in East Asia & Japan.
